messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] hs co-ops
messages.msgSnippet: What does legally organized mean? I know of a whole bunch of folks getting together to do all kinds of things. I have a friend offering lessons in Spanish to
messages.messageBody:
What does legally organized mean?

I know of a whole bunch of folks getting together to do all kinds of things.
I have a friend offering lessons in Spanish to hsing families in my
community. I haven't a clue how she would *organize legally*?

LisaKK
-----Original Message-----
From: Bill Ellis <tranet@...>
To: Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com <Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com>
Date: Sunday, September 10, 2000 1:02 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] hs co-ops


>
>Did I miss a post. I'm interested in h/s coops.
>Does anyone know of any "learning co-ops" of any kind?
>That is, legally organized cooperatives with the goal of providing learning
>opportunities for unschoolers of any age?
>Bill Ellis
> <http://www.CreatingLearningCommunities.org>
>

interesting....

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] hs co-ops
messages.msgSnippet: Did I miss a post.  I m interested in h/s coops. Does anyone know of any learning co-ops of any kind? That is, legally organized cooperatives with the goal
messages.messageBody:
Did I miss a post. I'm interested in h/s coops.
Does anyone know of any "learning co-ops" of any kind?
That is, legally organized cooperatives with the goal of providing learning
opportunities for unschoolers of any age?
Bill Ellis
<http://www.CreatingLearningCommunities.org>

----------
> From: Jaam1224@...
> Subject: Re: Digest Number 785--hs coops
>
> Debra,
> I want to come and learn with you guys. Your h/s coops sound interesting....
>
> Julie-unschooling herself
